intro: Calorhabdos arisanensis, commonly known as the Arisan firetail, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive bracts and often edible parts. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as mountain forests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
